title: Power - comparing force diagrams for power

content.question: An object of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is moving to the right along a horizontal surface with speed <math alttext="v sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> when a force of magnitude <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> is exerted on it, where <math alttext="F is less than m g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>F</mi><mo><</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mstyle></math>. In which of the following situations is the rate of energy being transferred to the object the greatest?

choices.label: The figure shows an object moving to the right along a horizontal surface at a speed of v sub i. A force of F is being exerted on it straight upward.
The figure shows an object moving to the right along a horizontal surface at a speed of v sub i. A force of F is being exerted on it directly to the left.
The figure shows an object moving to the right along a horizontal surface at a speed of v sub i. A force of F is being exerted on it directly to the right.
The figure shows an object moving to the right along a horizontal surface at a speed of v sub i. A force of F is being exerted on it diagonally upward and to the right.

content.answer: The figure shows an object moving to the right along a horizontal surface at a speed of v sub i. A force of F is being exerted on it directly to the right.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
